intro: Pleurospermum wolffianum, commonly known as the woolly pleurospermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, gray-green foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the cooler months. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
